Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay and convenient to airport and metro stop”
Reviews.Author: ShelleyP3
Reviews.Content: Very nice, modern hotel. Stayed there on April 7th and 8th 2012. They picked us up at the airport and were very helpful with advising us of what to do and see on our trip. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Near Airport”
Reviews.Author: tlittlej
Reviews.Content: Was a guest at this hotel March 18-19 for a 22hr layover in Madrid. I was pleasantly surprised by how modern it was. I've never heard of the chain, but would definitely look them up for another stay. They do offer a free shuttle, but should list their name on the shuttle board outside the airport. We checked into the hotel and then left to see Madrid. Its not close to town, but only a 15-20min metro ride to Gran Via. The room was spacious, but had one major flaw, the design of the shower. Its about half and inch off the floor, completely flat, with nothing preventing water from spilling out. My wife showered and water was ALL over the bathroom and hallway. There were places where the wood was warped and cracked because of it. Great Stay

Reviews.Title: “Nice modern hotel near airport”
Reviews.Author: deepfeeling
Reviews.Content: Nice, modern hotel. The rooms are clean and comfortable. The food is good too. And the most important thing is the stuff and specially at the reception they are very nice, smiley and helpful. I enjoyed Madrid and my short stay at Maydrit hotel. Thank U

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel, Good Value, Recommend”
Reviews.Author: sierragoddess
Reviews.Content: I stayed four nights at the Maydrit. Unfortunately, two of the nights and days, I was sick with flu. I was miserable, but, my room was so comfortable: bed comfortable, clean bathroom. Staff: pleasant and helpful. Location: an airport motel. but close to the metro, with about 30 minutes ride to main sites of Madrid. Quicker, easier and cheaper than trying to drive and park in town. If you are up for a walk, cross the footbridge across Ave de America, and within 15 minutes easy walk to very large mall: Centro Plenilunio. TIPS: Plan ahead, book online to get the best deals and special offers, like free wi-fi in the room. I didn't eat in the restaurant. There are no cafes or small restaurants near, exception is a Chinese restaurant across the street, opening late afternoon. Overall, I was impressed with the hotel, the staff, and location. I had to take a taxi to the airport and the fare was very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price, bad location.”
Reviews.Author: paulus70
Reviews.Content: If your idea is going to palacio de los congresos , ok. But if you intend going to the center of madrid for lunch or dinner, forget it. The crew is good and helps you a lot. The transfer is invaluable , without it they would have to close the hotel. Metro (los caprichos) is 5 minutes to the hotel, but 30 minutes to centre. Breakfast (14€ per head) not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice contemporary hotel close to Barajas Airport”
Reviews.Author: VicLS
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful and perfect for a short layover in Madrid. It's a short ride to the airport and one of the few hotels within walking distance to a metro station to go downtown. There is a scheduled shuttle van airport pick-up too. If you're driving, the roads are very narrow especially on weekends and evenings as it is in a residential neighborhood. The breakfast buffet (extra charge) is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “AC Marriott in Jerez”
Reviews.Author: ymcopeland
Reviews.Content: Rooms are nice, modern and clean, but very small. Twin beds pushed together are considered queen size beds. There's definetly a language barrier with the staff when speaking English. Instead of hiring a car it is feasible to take taxi's. Be warned, few of the taxi driver's will charge a surcharge. However, you are centrally located to the Renfe and AVE (train stations). The honor bar is replenished daily and the snacks in the lounge where good.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: griangraf2001
Reviews.Content: A very nicely decorated hotel, very handy for the airport. Staff were very friendly, and breakfast is really nice. All in all, a very enjoyable stay and I look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Good Service”
Reviews.Author: NMul
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the last weekend of October with my mum. The room was very well equipt, needed the wheelchair access room and everything that we needed was there. We cannot speak Spanish, but the staff there were quite accommodating. Food at the restaurant was fantastic, and the minibar in the room was a great extra! Overall, it was a pleasant stay at Maydrit.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a layover”
Reviews.Author: sandiegoguy
Reviews.Content: Have spent three separate nights at the Maydrit after arriving or preparing to leave Madrid Barajas airport. I don't see how you could find a better choice or value. Rooms are simple but very well designed, very comfortable, and extremely clean. Airport 15 minutes away by hotel shuttle (reserve in advance). Central Madrid 30 minutes by metro from station two blocks away. Food in dining room okay --- typical hotel fare. Staff perfunctory with limited English. This would be a four-star rating except for the Maydrit's odd and aggravating policy of charging 10 Euro per day for WiFi access.

Reviews.Title: “Nice new hotel near airport”
Reviews.Author: GRtraveler26
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the nights of Nov 3 and 4. We were flying out of Madrid early morning on the 5th, so we were looking for something close to the airport with a shuttle. Read the reviews on TripAdvisor, so we booked it. It was an excellent choice. Very new. Well appointed rooms. Very clean. Restaurant had very good food. Shuttle was on time and got us to airport in 10 minutes. It was about a 5 minute walk to the subway, and about 25 minutes via subway to Gran Via. Not ideal as a base for exploring Madrid, but we were only there for 2 nights and a day on the end of a trip. For a good hotel as a base to explore Madrid, we thought Hotel Ganivet worked well. But for a hotel near the airport, Hotel Maydrit would be very hard to beat. Will stay here again if flying out of Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good!”
Reviews.Author: bcrasto
Reviews.Content: The hotel was comfortable, clean, well decorated and with a good service. Located in a residential neighborhood, quiet and safe. The subway station was located 300 meters from the hotel and took about 30 minutes to reach the center of Madrid, but this was something he already knew. Would reccomend.

Reviews.Title: “very modern and clean-would stay again”
Reviews.Author: hhutchisonStirling
Reviews.Content: lovely, modern and clean hotel only 10min from airport.We found hotel taxi shuttle service was available for us free both ways[and out -with advertised service hours].Half hour journey on tube but very cheap at 1euro 50 [we purchased 3 day pass at 13 euro which was great for us staying for a few days]. Food was tasty-more than ample for breakfast,with cafe/restaurant serving fairly good choice menu throughout the day/evening. Room very spacious and clean with linen changed daily.Tv had couple of british chanels. Over all- good value- great hotel would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “WE LIKED MOST OF IT”
Reviews.Author: Carol51181
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two nights after being on the road in Europe for 22 days. Hotel was clean and modern and bedding was great except we got two twin beds pushed together vs a King or Queen. We too had issues with the shuttle as we did not arrive via Madrid airport but came in via train from Toledo and did not realize that the shuttle has very limited hours. But, we sorted it out using a local bus recommended by the front desk when we called but could have been upset with a 25 euro cab ride. We were also told that we could not drink our own wine outside as that was bar area and no other area was provided outside and the weather was beautiful, but we could have drank our wine in the lobby? The metro is a short two block walk and it does take 30 minutes to get into Madrid Central, but that was OK with us. We were also able to partake in an excellent two for one breakfast deal since it was the weekend. Well worth the 15 euros for the two of us. I would recommend this Hotel for folkk going to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Newer Hotel-Pre-Flight Stay”
Reviews.Author: Missriverview
Reviews.Content: As previous reviewers have noted, this is not a good base for visiting Madrid, but a perfect pre-flight hotel. Clean, comfortable and very modern. Shuttle service was effecient, however, the hotel never did respond to many emails from us or our friends asking about the shuttle. We finally received the information we needed by having the concierge from our previous hotel call and help us make sure the shuttle would be waiting for us upon arrival. It was also disappointing to find that internet was not free, nor was there a convenient way to print boarding passes. I would think given this airport location that a station for boarding passes would be available as this is a common service at airport hotels. Breakfast on the other hand was very reasonable and excellent. Overall a very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Madrid!!”
Reviews.Author: vicki18
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as for 4 nights. The hotel is very clean and modern. The metro is just down the road but it does take about 30 mins to get to the centre of Madrid. This wasn't really a problem for us as we had 5 days and wern't in any particular rush. The hotel has a bar which isn't that exspensive, although we only had a drink in there.There are a few restaurants near the hotel that seemed ok. When we got to the airport we tried to get a taxi but the taxi driver said he had never heard of the hotel?? Think this might have been as it was a short fare we ended up getting the 101 bus which took 10 mins! Overall a nice hotel maybe a tad far out though

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and value.”
Reviews.Author: anyscreenname
Reviews.Content: Couldn't fault our stopover here. Staff very helpful. Metro nearby. Good room.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for sightseeing, but defiantly a corporate hotel”
Reviews.Author: toastydave
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week in October after reading the positive reviews... it is a 5 minute walk to the subway (from room door to station entrance) then about 30 minutes to Sol. it sounds a lot but it is really no big deal, before you know it, you have gone from a nice quite neighbourhood to the hustle and bustle of the centre. The positives are the hotel is quite, cheap, modern (think £200 Hilton in centre of London) has a pool (which only seems to be open from April to end of September) you can not really hear the airport and it is quite close. The negatives are its no bother to head into and out of town once a day, but a chore if you want a siesta mid day as it is an hour round trip... there is nothing really around the hotel, but I spend most of my nights in town, so not an issue. No free wifi is a poor show and even if you do pay there's no wifi at all outside of the lobby (free wifi can be found at Starbucks or vips in town). also no tea or coffee facility's in the room or lobby didn't eat in the hotel so cannot comment, I think it was about €12 each for breakfast overall for the price I would stay again. oh and btw the real price to get a taxi from the airport to this hotel should be around €9.50 - €10, the taxi driver I used at the airport tried to set a rate of €25 (A licensed official white airport taxi) or better still get the hotel shuttle (which you have to call for on your cell phone)

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel...almost”
Reviews.Author: ScottishMyszka
Reviews.Content: Maydrit is a very attractive hotel, modern and sparkling clean. We enjoyed staying there overnight before flight back home. Other users pointed it out , I would just like to add that booking the shuttle for the airport is essential as minibus takes up to 8 people at a time. We were pleased that we booked earlier as there were 8 of us going at 7.30 to airport and the reception staff made a point that only people booked in advance would be offered the place. We also booked our room in advance choosing the price with breakfast included. However it turned out that at weekends and on public holidays breakfast would be available from 8 am, there was no chance of even a cup of coffee.The receptionist charged full amount stating that as we chose with breakfast we had to pay for it. Logical? Not a big deal but poor PR for Santos Hotels ,which we had used happily in the past. We had a snack in the Cafe of the hotel in the evening as there are no restaurants around apart from Chinese one. It was ok but pricey for what it was. Good hotel to stay one night but would not be convenient for sightseeing in Madrid, at least 14 stops of the metro from the centre.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for early/late flight out of Madrid Airport”
Reviews.Author: travelindoc2007
Reviews.Content: Spent one night with 2 rooms before our flight left the next morning. Rooms were super clean, well appointed and comfortable-only down side was that the "double" bed was 2 twins (commen theme in Spain). Bathroom was nice altho shower was eally narrow-not sure why cuz the bathroom was very spacious!Room was very quiet, lighting great for reading. It is far from the "tourist" part of town, but the airport shuttle and proximetry trumped that. Check in was smooth with adaquete english by employees. Restaurant is open all day ( a plus!) and was quite good, surprisingly! Spent a lazy late afternoon in the "outdoor" lounge on comfy couches and chairs. Shuttle service was prompt and effecient in a very clean van and driver with a suit and tie. One quirk for us--you have to insert your room card into the box by the door to activate the power in the room--we couldn't figure that out without help from the maid down the hall!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: Tricia063
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 1 night at the Maydrit hotel. It is ultra modern with all all the necessary facilities. Only thing that disappointed me, was that there was no free WIFI. Very close to airport and also Metro for going into Madrid town. Free shuttle to airport. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Very beautiful fantastic luxury hotel A+++++++++”
Reviews.Author: SophieSSS
Reviews.Content: Absolutely fantastic stay at this beautiful, air-conditioned, clean, luxury hotel set in a lovely quiet area with a few local shops, myself and my partner stayed there for 5 nights for his birthday and they were simply faultless, Madrid is really accessible from the Metro (line 5) which is really close to the hotel (3 min walk) and you can travel to central Madrid and back for two euros and its a 20min journey on a very clean and safe metro which runs until 1.30am ish (very handy for spending the evening exploring the bars!), i have stayed in a lot of hotels and this really was one of the nicest, if not the nicest hotel i have ever stayed in, Pool was fantastic as was the entire outdoor area which was to a very high quality, they even allowed us to check our bags in on the last day so we could explore Madrid without our bags, very pleased with our entire stay, trip of a lifetime that we won't forget anytime soon. Thank-you Maydrit!

Reviews.Title: “Very good option very close to the airport.”
Reviews.Author: Brazil1703
Reviews.Content: Quite new property, offers practical and clean rooms. It’s quite, the air conditioning is impeccable and it was very clean. I just missed a free internet zone in the hotel. It is located very close to the Barajás airport, but it is far from the old downtown. You will need a car or take the metro (5 min. walking) to visit the historical sites.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent 4 days at the Maydrit! Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Danielle L
Reviews.Content: Just back from 3 nights and 4 days at the Hotel Maydrit- it was excellent!! The hotel is located in a quiet residential area on the outskirts of the city- a perfect location for relaxing, sunbathing and taking nice walks! We arrived at 2pm when the shuttle wasnt operating- but it was only 15 euros including the airport supplement which isnt bad at all! Just make sure you have the hotel address or a little map of its location printed out as the taxi driver hadnt heard of it- but found it with his sat nav! The hotel is lovely, very clean and definately of 4 star standard! Our room was impressive, the air con worked perfectly and there was an English tv channel. The beds were sooo comfortable and soft! All the staff were very helpful- the staff at reception printed off maps for us to walk to the nearby shopping mall which was only 10 minute walk away. The bar and restaurant staff were also lovely and very helpful. The pool area was great! The pool was bigger than it looks in the photos- about 10m long and has 4 sunbeds and plenty of room to lay your towel down to sunbathe. There is also a lovely garden area just next to the pool with comfy chairs to lounge on while having a drink or a snack. The metro station is about 5 minute walk away up the street and it costs 1 euro 50 to get to the city centre, the metro was clean and very easy to use! There is also 2 little shops close by to buy water/ drinks/ snacks/ ice creams and there is a cheap Chinese restaurant right accross the street. There is a shopping mall about 10-15 minute walk away with loads of shops including H&M, Zara, Primark and also has restaurants and fast food such as Burger King and McDonalds. Ive seen that people have commented that you have to pay for internet- if you check the computers sometimes theres time still left on the counter and so me and my boyfriend found we were able to use the net for free quite a few times! :) I would definately recommend the Maydrit as somewhere that is calm and tranquil compared to the busy city- however the city is only 20 mins away by Metro to pop in and out! I had a lovely long weekend sunbathing and relaxing and would go back anytime!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull stay, can't wait to come back”
Reviews.Author: Franceschina88
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel two nights but we would never want to come on. Everything is perfect, the room was spacious, clean, well furnished and with all the comforts (even stocked the welcome kit). I can not judge the restaurant as I have not used it. Staff very friendly and helpful. The only thing that might scare you is the distance from the center of the city but with the metro at 2 minutes of walking, it's not a problem. I look forward to returning to Madrid to stay in this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Great price, close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: ln2inSegovia
Reviews.Content: When we were living in Segovia, access to Barajas was tricky, particularly for early morning flights. However, we discovered Hotel Maydrit a year ago. It is 1km from the airport and is modern (IKEAish) and well-priced. If you book midweek and in-advance, you can usually get a room for 60-70€s (possibly at other times as well, we've only ever used it midweek). The rooms are well-equipped and have very comfy beds. The staff is friendly and helpful. The only limitation is the shuttle. It doesn't start until 7am and we've actually never managed to use it (you need to book in advance). However, if you bring your car, there's fee-parking at the hotel, and mid-week easy-to-find parking outside the hotel (for free).

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hilton quality - would go back”
Reviews.Author: morrisonm
Reviews.Content: I went to Madrid from Vigo on a whim by myself. Found Hotel Maydrit online. Asked for free shuttle ride ahead of time to and from airport as recommended. You get there in 5 minutes! Location is strange, in a neighborhood, but very quiet and I felt safe. Metro is literally only about 3 blocks away and is very cheap, 1 Euro. It is at the end of the green line, but it only takes about 20 minutes to ride to the Prado and that area. Room was very modern with flat screen TV. Very comfortable bed and sheets ( I would compare to nice Hiltons in the states). Modern and clean shower and bathroom. Everything was perfect. Excellent front staff who helped me (in English) with how to ride Metro to the sites I wanted. Breakfast buffet was a bit pricey and ok, but I'd rather eat a cafe in Madrid. Didn't use pool, but it looked nice. good price for the hotel, stayed 2 nights. Great service!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very modern”
Reviews.Author: ReneeandJohn
Reviews.Content: We stayed here to be near the Airport and they offered a free airport transfer. It was a good choice. Hotel is only few minutes walk from the metro stop. For 1euro it is only 20 min metro commute to the downtown area. The room was very quite, clean, spacious and modern with a huge comfortable bed. What more could you want.

Reviews.Title: “Clean room, no tourist info.”
Reviews.Author: sherrycr
Reviews.Content: I wanted a room close to the airport. The Maydrit offered fantastic rates, a clean, modern room. However, despite the fact that it is a five minute (or less) walk to the Metro, DO NOT take the Metro from the airport because it will take nearly an hour due to having to transfer twice. When returning to the airport, I took the Maydrit's free shuttle which came on time and took me directly to the terminal in less than 10 minutes. The Maydrit is not on the same Metro line as the airport. It was very easy to take the Metro downtown for a day of sightseeing. However, the trip was about 20 minutes. The Maydrit is not set up for tourists. They have no brochures or maps and although reception desk personnel spoke English, they were not able to give any information (i.e. what time does the Prado open/close on Sunday). So, you must relay on other sources for tourism. The television menu said they had a few english speaking channels such as CNN, but it turned out that was not true. Apparently the hotel decides whether it is time for heat or air conditioning, but you can't have both. Therefore, no a/c was offered while I was there, but the window did open a few inches. If you want a clean, inexpensive room near the airport with access to the metro to go downtown, this is a good hotel. The internet service in the lobby is expensive. I did have a safe in my room with a changeable combination lock. I also had a refrig. The pool was closed for the season. Some of the reception personnel spoke english. They were friendly, but not very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Weyland
Reviews.Content: We were going in and out of Madrid. When we arrived we found that we had forgotten to make reservations, however they came and got us and put us up in the hotel. They did not have space for us when we were to come back to Madrid in a week but kept our luggage and picked us up at the airport when we came back. The driver even waited for us when our baggage was delayed. The staff was very helpful and pleasant. Sunday night there was not much open in the area for eating except for the hotel. Otherwise, nice hotel and staff. Wifi and computer cost a good bit to use.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy but far from the city”
Reviews.Author: Buggsie1221
Reviews.Content: We were in Madrid for 2 nights, the hotel is far from the city (20 mins by train) but the metro is like a 2 min walk, number 5 line, the stop before the last stop. Location wise its in a residential area, there is a small super market which is also a 5 minute walk, a few restaurants, a chinese one which is 50 seconds away. The shuttle is a big help if you have an early flight. We booked the shuttle and had no problem. Did not try their breakfast though it looked good. The staffs are very attentive. Overall, a good stay. Also, you will have to pay extra for the internet.

Reviews.Title: “15 Minute Metro from Grand Via”
Reviews.Author: kcribb1
Reviews.Content: I needed a room near the airport before my return flight to the States. The hotel was a STEAL for 51 euro, and I booked directly with the hotel. A very large hotel room with a modern touch. Great hotel and location for a night prior to a flight. No issues with transportation or walk-up call. I would stay at the hotel again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel near Madrid Barajas airport”
Reviews.Author: mergind
Reviews.Content: Good hotel near Madrid Barajas airport to pass an overnight near the airport, has a free shuttle transfer between 07:00-11:00 am, or 07:00-11:00 pm. If you need to go to the airport in another hours, the taxi cost around 20 €. Rooms are very spacious, nice and clean. Good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, super value, excellent condition and super clean”
Reviews.Author: wpmchesternj
Reviews.Content: This is a superb hotel to do an overnight or more at Madrid Barajas airport. It is superior to other airport hotels as it is located within 300 meters of the Metro with a direct line to Gran Via, just one stop away from Plaza Del Sol, Plaza Mayor and Corte Ingles at the Sol Metro stop. The rooms are modern and very clean, the staff friendly (if you speak Spanish it is a plus), and the onsite restaurant, while expensive, is a better value than other airport hotels. I will definitely consider this hotel in my future travel plans to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff. Missed flight.”
Reviews.Author: Lex7718
Reviews.Content: The rooms at the Maydrit are very nice, but the reception staff is rude, the "free" internet access costs 6 Euros an hours (no refunds if you use only ten minutes) and as they neglected to make my 6 am wake-up call (no clocks in the rooms) I missed my flight home, resulting in a lot of scrambling and a huge expense I hadn't expected. (no apology from the staff, even after they admitted the wake-up call had not been made.) They do have a shuttle to the airport every half hour after 7 am, (a 15 minute ride) which is nice, but the driver was surly.

Reviews.Title: “Sharp hotel. Out of town, but near Metro”
Reviews.Author: skipcaptain
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights in October 2010. Immaculately clean. Very sharp and modern. Easy set up Wi-Fi for each room (EUR10/day). Big bed, fantastically comfortable and great pillows. Stayed in 2 different types of rooms. One on lower floor had a bath, upper floor had better view but no bath. Both large rooms. Small fridge with mini-bar in room. Air con good. Big screen LCD worked fine. Hotel generally quiet at night. About EUR20 by taxi from the airport. Write down the address beforehand as most taxis do not know where it is. 5 minute walk to the Metro. El Capricho station is about 20 minutes ride to the centre of town. Breakfast was good and thorough. Dinner menu limited but the cuttlefish entre was divine and the steak was very good also. I believe there are a couple of restaurants nearby but I did not try them. The front desk staff and at least one in the restaurant spoke english fairly well. No gym unfortunately but a park is 5 minutes away if you need to go for a walk/run. There was a pool but being autumn it was covered so I did not try it. I stayed here for work and can recommend the hotel. If you are sightseeing and shopping in Madrid however you might want to stay closer to town.

Reviews.Title: “Confortable, modern hotel. Great value”
Reviews.Author: twarren42
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Maydrit twice during our recent Spain vacation. We chose it because of it's airport shuttle and proximity to the metro. The staff, facilities and rooms were all excellent. Our only criticism is that the airport shuttle has very limited hours (7AM-11AM and 7PM to 11PM.) As a result, we had to take a 20 euro taxi ride to the airport instead.

Reviews.Title: “Good value close to airport”
Reviews.Author: texmln
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel on the first and last nights of a two week business trip to Europe. It's location close to MAD is great and the free shuttle is a plus. The only drawback with the shuttle is it's limited operating hours in the morning and night. However, a taxi is cheap to this hotel and the reasonable room rates make it worthwhile if necessary. For that reasonable rate you get a fairly new, modern hotel room with all the amenities including the all important cold air conditioning commonly lacking in European hotels. The hotel is located in a quiet residential area so a good night's sleep is all but guaranteed. The staff was very helpful and the restaurant had good food. For those needing to overnight close the airport, this hotel is excellent and I had no complaints. After staying in seven other hotels during my twelve day trip, I really looked forward to returning to the Maydrit the night before my flight. It's a comfortable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel - shame about some of the staff”
Reviews.Author: WalksUk
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great find. For us it was perfectly located as it wasn't to close to the city but easily commutable via the metro. The metro also goes from the Barajas airport to a stop called "el capricho" which is 100 metres from the hotel and costs just 1 euro per person. The only problem for us was the unfriendly reception staff. Very sour faced and even though they would answer questions and deal with problems there disposition made approaching them seem like a hassle. Especially a small, red haired female receptionist who had ‘can’t smile syndrome’ and a bad attitude. Definitely not the type of service wanted front of house at a 4* hotel of this standard. Other staff (cleaners, cafeteria staff were far better). Apart from that great hotel and a definite recommendation. p.s swimming pool was out of order for the whole time

Reviews.Title: “Where's the Shuttle ?”
Reviews.Author: Sinistro
Reviews.Content: We chose this Hotel because they had a shuttle to/from the airport, because we had 2 flights in 2 days. The day we arrived the phone line's of the Hotel were down, and if you want the shuttle to get you, you had to call the Hotel first. So after waiting for about 2 hour's for the possibility of shuttle, we took a taxi, and paid close to 30€. In the Hotel the only comment on that was close to "the line's were down, so bad luck". Our natural next step was booking the shuttle to the next day. In the next morning, in the middle of one sour milk breakfast, we were rushed by the front desk to the shuttle, close to 30 min. before the determined hour, that without any prior notice. We aren't coming back, that's certain, in any of this mess we got an apologetic voice.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy room near the airport”
Reviews.Author: Julienchito
Reviews.Content: Hotel Maydrit is well located near the airport ( 10 min drive from the airport and 10€ by taxi ) but a bit far from city center if you want to visit. They offer a free lift on the morning and at night to/from the airport. Room : All you need for a business trip. Clean, spacious, quiet and trendy with television ( English, French and German channel ). The negative point goes to the paying WI-FI connection. 10€ per day is for me excessive for a hotel living from business travelers. Recommendation : Overall, I would recommend this hotel to business travelers. Could be a bit expensive but location is fine.

Reviews.Title: “Lucky Punch”
Reviews.Author: FELISHAandMICHAEL
Reviews.Content: We booked a room in this hotel for one night, because our flight was leaving Madrid airport the next morning. It was a lucky punch we found it thanks to TRIPADVISOR. The hotel is very clean and super modern. The rooms are excellent, big and clean. Even the breakfast buffet was huge all things were fresh and tasty. The location is perfect - it's very quiet and safe, with all important things around and it's very close to the airport and city center. There were 2 things we did not like. 1.The girls at the reception and other staff. I think the word friendly and smile does not exist in the Spanish language or their pay must be that bad? 2.You have to pay extra for things like WLAN on your room, or parking in the hotel owned parking garage. After all we had a very pleasant stay with only small things which could be improved.

Reviews.Title: “Great sleep near the airport.”
Reviews.Author: croozinsoozin
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed these nice rooms - comfy beds, modern (open) bathrooms, and quiet atmosphere. The only complaint I had is that the shower water got barely lukewarm - a minor complaint, though, as this hotel allowed us a great night's sleep before our long flight home. The airport shuttle to the airport was a big plus - sure beat the crazy taxi-driver that drove us to the hotel the night before! I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay if you need to be near the airport!”
Reviews.Author: islandervne
Reviews.Content: we stayed here our last night in madrid because we had an early flight out the next morning. it is really in the middle of no where but served its purpose with a free airport shuttle every half hour starting at 7am (not sure how late it runs). El Capricho (line 5) is very close when you get out of the subway station. it was kind of funny because we came out the metro and looked around and saw...nothing. haha. don't worry, it seemed really residential and safe there. the rooms are large and comfortable (and if you ask for two separate beds, it's actually 3 beds in the room). the staff is friendly and speaks english. no free WIFI but there are two laptops you can use in the lobby. oh yeah, and the teeny tiny swimming pool closes at 7:30 pm. there is also a large american style mall about a 25 minute walk away (ask the front desk for directions and to draw a map. just make sure you go OVER a walking bridge and then you have to go under an overpass to see the mall....) there is a very large supermarket there and also movie theater. just in case you haven't gotten your fill of ZARA or mossimo dutti (or mango, blanco, etc.etc.), i think they actually had a better selection of stuff at the mall. lol. if you need a convenient place to stay near barajas, i highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Met Our Overnight Needs”
Reviews.Author: Viajeros305
Reviews.Content: If you have an early flight and need to stay near the airport this is the hotel to stay in. After spending a week in the South of Spain my husband and I needed a hotel room in Madrid prior to an early flight out the following day. The Maydrit provided the perfect setting for spa-like relaxation. Very modern and sleek appearance, clean and comfortable accomodations with standard ammenities. The beds were wonderful and just what we needed after alot of sightseeing/walking. They have wifi service in your room at 10.00 euros for 24 hrs. or they have a computer center at an hourly charge in the lobby. The hotel is located in a residential/business park type suburb. It was Sunday and everything around the hotel was closed. They do have a nice trendy cafe in the hotel available. The staff very helpful in guiding with a schedule and a map of the clean metro train station/train that is located a short and easy to find walk away. Its an approx. 20 min. ride at 2 euros round trip per person to the center of "La Gran Via" Madrid and other major sites. We found a place to eat and shop there. We scheduled the free airport schuttle for a 7 am pickup to the airport and it arrived on time. The only downfall was that because we arrived on Sunday afternoon the schuttle service does not begin until 7 pm on Sundays, therefore, we had to take a taxi for 23.00 Euros to the hotel. That was our only frustration. Make sure you call ahead and schedule a pickup/dropoff. Overall we highly reccommend this hotel especially if you need a very comfortable hotel to stay near the airport.

Reviews.Title: “super”
Reviews.Author: MinnesotaHockeyMom09
Reviews.Content: Very close to Madrid Airport (15 min). Clean, comfortable, quiet and with internet. Hotel staff very polite. They provide free shuttle to airport starting at 7 a.m.Restaurant open til 11:00 p.m. Try the eggs and ham!!! Subway very close. 1- 1/2 blks. You can see hotel from the station. I'm a mom and traveled with my 19 yr old son. We felt very safe. We were bumped from flight so we had to stay extra day. We took subway to downtown Madrid for day and it took 30 min. I'm and airline employee and would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute diamond when I was expecting mediocrity”
Reviews.Author: cairns09
Reviews.Content: I have travelled to conferences previously and have almost always been disappointed by the hotel that I have requested. None of the taxi drivers knew how to get here as the place is newly built. The hotel was amazing from walking into reception to an exceptional room. If you are staying in Madrid I would recommend staying here while the prices are so reasonable, although not close to the city centre the underground is just 200m away - so there is easy access to anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “should have listened to the bad reviews about the shuttle...”
Reviews.Author: backpackingwithstyle
Reviews.Content: Just read the other reviews. Don't think the following: "If i call or email the airport to confirm the airport shuttle (as promised on expedia) that it will ensure that I get a shuttle" We did this and even though they told us just to call when we arrived (we gave them our flight time and everything)., when we did arrive they said we would have to wait 4 hours to get picked up and that there shuttle only ran in the morning and evening. They told us this even though we confirmed out flight time (in std. and 24-hour time). And, as it turns out, there are days the shuttle doesn't even run, so just because you arrive in the morning/evening doesn't guarentee you the service. if you do get stuck, it is VERY easy to take the metro - it just takes some time because there's no direct line and you have to go south and then back north on the train. The customer service people at the airport metro stop were extremely helpful. They even printed us a map! Also, the hotel is located steps from a metro which made it convenient to go downtown for the night, before flying out the next day. the only reason we chose this hotel was because we wanted our last day of our one-month trip to be hassle-free. screw that. (there was also a sale on expedia -- we didn't pay full rate which is very high).

Reviews.Title: “A lovely experience”
Reviews.Author: mblxv
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because it was close to the airport and cheap -- a recipe for disaster. We were thrilled to find it located in a quiet residential neighborhood just a few steps off the Metro. The hotel was cool, sleep, very modern. We were able to get dinner in the area at midnight and there was a free shuttle in the morning. I will definitely consider staying here next time I visit Madrid even though it's a bit off the beaten path. Small drawback was no wireless in the room but there were terminals in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here if you want a hotel near the airport”
Reviews.Author: ilove2travel53
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because it was listed as being near the airport and had a free airport shuttle. However, I ended up having to pay $75 for a taxi to take me to the hotel. No one in the airport had ever heard of this hotel and the taxi driver dropped me off at the wrong hotel. Hotel Maydrit refused to come and pick me up--hence the huge taxi bill. The hotel staff offered no help or sympathy. It was an awful experience. I wrote a letter to hotel management and they didn't respond. I wouldn't ever stay here again. Definately keep looking for another hotel that has better service and is closer to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel on our week in Spain”
Reviews.Author: LarryN
Reviews.Content: Although its far from town, the metro is steps away and a quick 20 minutes from downtown. The rooms were nice and comfortable. Free airport shuttle is a plus. I had the info center at the airport call them in spanish for a pickup. beds were really nice but the restaurant was pretty outrageous. go elsewhere. there are a few restaurants near, find them on google or google earth.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, dismal staff”
Reviews.Author: sunshinelollipop
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on the last night of our trip to Spain. It was chosen due to its proximity to the airport. This hotel does have an airport shuttle, but it is not advertised in the airport at all and we only learned of it after arriving at the hotel and asking the staff there. Staff were rude and seemed disinterested in their customers, not something we had experienced at other hotels in Spain. We were not given any information about the hotel amenities upon arrival. The rooms were nice and spacious but we had some problems with the poor drainage system in the shower. Also interesting was that there is no door from the bathroom area to the rest of the room. Overall, this was an acceptable hotel for a one night stay but we wouldn't return again.

Reviews.Title: “Super Overnight hotel with free airport shuttle”
Reviews.Author: spain2007
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel in a quiet residential area. There are 3 childrens playgrounds nearby if you have small kids with you. I would absolutely recommend this hotel if you need overnight accommodations and location isn't a factor. There are not a lot of restaurants nearby but the neighborhood bars are a plus and do serve meals. The breakfast buffet at the hotel was good. It had a good selection and priced at 12 euros during our stay. The room was spotless, quiet, and energy efficient. We enjoyed our short stay and the airport shuttle was prompt. Service was outstanding here.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a traveler wanting to stay near the airport”
Reviews.Author: HoosierBob
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the night prior to flying out of Madrid. It was a 20 euro taxi from the Airport. though the hotel offers shuttle service to and from the airport, we could not make the arrangement when we arrived from Murcia. But we were able to sign up for the shuttle to the airport the following morning. This hotel is very modern and I'm assuming new. Rooms are spacious and the shower was excellent. We did not eat in the restaurant so we can't comment on it. It is about a 30-35 minute Metro ride into downtown Madrid (Prado), so if you want to see the sights of Old Madrid this is not the location for you. But if you are a business traveler or need a place near the airport, this hotel is great. The Metro stop is a short 3-4 minute walk behind the hotel on a direct line/street.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel very close to MAD airport”
Reviews.Author: Guatraveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is real close to a subway stop so it saved us a taxi cab. It is a beautiful new hotel. The hotel shuttle was right on time and got us and all our bags to the airport with no charge. The room is new and very large. The bathroom was state of the art bathroom for hotels. Super, super nice. Staff was great and helpful. It was a short stay but a very pleasant one. There are a number of places to eat around the hotel besides eating at the hotel. This was a bargin price for the quality of this hotel. They have wireless internet but it is a 6 euro charge per day. They also have plug ins for your computer if you have the cords with you. Don't expect to make a trip to Madrid again but I love to stay there again. Oh, the bed was very comfortable with great pillows.

Reviews.Title: “Four star hotel at two star prices”
Reviews.Author: Doug_Competa
Reviews.Content: A new hotel which seems to be offering very competitive rates as it gets established. The only down side is the distance from the centre, though there is a metro station a couple of hundred yards away. Plentiful free parking available in the streets around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Strange Study in Contrasts”
Reviews.Author: lifesaver1
Reviews.Content: This hotel has some strong highs and lows. It is brand new, very modern, with a minimalist style. The rooms are large, with free wifi throughout, large TV, faux wood floors, and very modern bathroom fixtures. It is conveniently located within a few miles of the airport and near a metro station. They have a courtesy van, although it seems as though you can only summon it by calling the hotel directly (i.e. no kiosks at the airport). There are no clocks in the rooms (or alarm clocks or clock radios). I don't think I've experienced this in even a cheap hotel, much less an airport hotel. The hotel, although seemingly empty, was strangely noisy, because for some reason doors of other rooms opening and closing echoed throughout, very loudly. As well, a TV on in one room could be heard in another, apparently because of the echo effects in rooms without carpet. The view is of an overgrown, trash strewn, vacant lot, but the hotel seems to be beside a nice neighborhood area. The only restaurant is understaffed, presumably because the hotel is not much used. It is lit like an army cafeteria, with bright lights. It is very unwelcoming, in that it is so stark. The staff (there was a single person when I was there with a colleague), was nice, but oblivious to the concept of expeditious service. The food was fine. The beds are new and OK, but nothing great. They use the Scandanavian approach of no cover sheet, but rather a sheet-wrapped quilt. If you like that, it's fine. I find it uncomfortable because to regulate your body temperature, you have to either lower the temperature of the room or stick parts of your body out from under, so parts are cold and parts are hot. Bottom line, this hotel has things to offer and things to avoid. The only reason to be here would seem to be an overnight near the airport. My sense is that if it were busier, it would be noisier. A less sparkling or new hotel might be more desirable, but I do not know what the competition is like.

HotelInfo.Name: Maydrit Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Piragua 1, 28042 Madrid, Spain
